text: hi this is Seema and I'm back with a new

indicate companionship or friendship or
being really close to someone so
therefore to greet someone with open
arms it means nothing but to give
someone a warm welcome and who would you
give a warm welcome to you would give a
warm welcome to someone that you are
very close to it could be a family
member a friend or a very very close
relative so you can say that I greeted
my mother with open arms after meeting
her for a year so that's what greeting
someone with open arms is all about our
next expression is behind ones back well
whenever something is done behind your
back we're talking about something that
is done very secretly
and this is not a very good thing so if
someone is doing something beyond your
back they're doing something very
secretly without you knowing about it so
I can say something like Susan's

something like television brainwashes

something like terrorist or terrorism
makes people believe that war is done
for peace so brainwashing is actually

does that indicate it talks about

so I can say something like the little

blaming someone or accusing them our
next expression talks about standing on

so all of you who have probably got a

so standing on one's feet is nothing but

something independently our next

jaw-dropping
well when my jaw drops what does that

dropping so jaw dropping is nothing but

so I can say that the view from the

our last expression talks about to keep
a straight face
okay what does it mean to keep a
straight face this is an expression we
use when we are trying to hide our
laughter or hide our amusement now a lot
of times you know people do something in
front of you and it's really funny but
you don't want to laugh in front of them
because they might feel a little bad and
therefore you try to hide your laughter
or you try to hide your amusement and
that is what it means to keep a straight
face so you can say something like my
friend is a bad dancer but he tried
dancing in front of me but I had to keep
a straight face because his dance was so
funny that I had to hide my laughter
hide my amusement and that's what
keeping a straight face is all about
keeping a straight face or hiding your
amusement or your laughter even though
you really want to laugh out very loud
